greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k > 1 such that k^n == 1 (mod n).
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If p is prime a(p)=p+1 and a(2p)=2p-1; if n is in A050384 a(n)=n+1; if n is in A067945 a(n)=3 etc. It seems that sum(k=1, n, a(k)) is asymptotic to c*n^2 with c=0.2...
maple: P:=proc(n) local k; k:=2; while k^n mod n<>1 do k:=k+1; od; k; end:
mathematica: Do[k = 2; While[ !IntegerQ[(k^n - 1)/n], k++ ]; Print[k], {n, 1, 80}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(s=2); while(Mod(s,n)^n-1!=0, s++); return(s) \\ _Rémy Sigrist_, Apr 02 2017
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 07 2002
